com.clcain.arithmeticexpression

Class ArithmeticExpression

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.clcain.arithmeticexpression.ArithmeticExpression

  • public class ArithmeticExpression
extends java.lang.Object
    Object representation of an arithmetic expression. Arithmetic expressions contain numbers and operators.
    Version:
    2015.08.03
    Author:
    Chandler Cain (chandler@clcain.com)

    • Constructor Summary

      Instantiate a new object as a clone of the given object.
      ArithmeticExpression(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> numbers, java.util.ArrayList<Operator> operators)
      Instantiate a new object from the given lists of numbers and operators.

      Get the sum of the expression in its current state.

      • getSum

        public double getSum(java.util.List<Operator> operatorOrder)
        Get the sum of the expression in its current state.
        Parameters:
        operatorOrder - a list of the order in which operations will be performed
        Returns:
        the sum of the expression

      • getSumSequential

        public double getSumSequential()
        Get the sum of the expression in its current state without applying any order of operations. Operators will be applied in sequential order from first to last.
        Returns:
        the sum of the expression

        Overrides:

      • isComplete

        public boolean isComplete()
        Check whether the expression is complete in its current state.
        Returns:
        a boolean signifying whether the expression is complete
